item.title: Quickstart
item.description: Prerequisites Before we get started, let’s make sure you meet these following requirements: Web A working MySQL/MariaDB database PHP Version = 8.1.x (for SB++ 1.8.0 release) GMP extension (for A2S queries) Game Sourcemod >= 1.10 Metamod: Source If you’re using Cloudflare, Rocket Loader must be disabled otherwise SourceBans++ will become unresponsive.

item.title: Inquiries
item.description: PluginBan player option is missing in SourceMod’s admin menu! Most likely SourceMod’s basebans.smx was still loaded when you installed SourceBans' game plugin. The game plugin automatically disables basebans.smx, but your server needs to be restarted for the “Ban player” option to come available. Some hosters might disallow plugins to move files. Make sure the basebans.smx is in the plugins/disabled folder. WebPlayer list displays “Max Players” instead of all the players Add host_players_show 2 to your server.

item.title: Updating
item.description: Downloading Download the latest zip-archive from the releasepage Web Panel Backup your database in case of corruption Switch back to the default theme if haven’t already Upload and overwrite all contents in webto your SourceBans++ installation Delete installdirectory Navigate to your SourceBans++ website and append updaterafter it (Ex: example.com/updater, example.com/sb/updater) After it displays Installation up-to-date., delete updaterdirectory and you are done

item.title: Discord Forward Setup
item.description: Prerequisites SteamWorks SMJansson Installing Grab the latest sbpp_discord.smx from here Upload the plugin to addons/sourcemod/plugins Configuring Add the convar sbpp_discord_banhook and assign the value of the Discord webhook link for where you want ban messages to go Add the convar sbpp_discord_reporthook and assign the value of the Discord webhook link for where you want report messages to go (If missing, it will default to sbpp_discord_banhook’s convar value)

item.title: Database Errors
item.description: Access Denied If not self-hosted, please make sure your host allows remote connections This problem is often related to user accounts that the server permits View MariaDB #Granting for more info Can’t connect to MySQL server Normally means that there is no MySQL server running on the system or that you are using an incorrect Unix socket file name or TCP/IP port number when trying to connect to the server.

item.title: Debugging Connection
item.description: Check list Your host is not blocking any traffic on your game server port (UDP Incoming & TCP Outgoing) Your game server is online to people outside of your network w/o any error on binding You can connect to server in-game You can use RCON through in-game console, if not view TCP Error below Using the debug tool In SourceBans++’s root directory, there’s a connection debug tool named sb_debug_connection.

item.title: MariaDB
item.description: Adding Repo sudo apt-get install software-properties-common sudo apt-key adv --recv-keys --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 0xF1656F24C74CD1D8 sudo add-apt-repository 'deb [arch=amd64,i386,ppc64el] http://nyc2.mirrors.digitalocean.com/mariadb/repo/10.2/ubuntu xenial main' sudo apt-get update Installing sudo apt-get install mariadb-server Setup Run mysql_secure_installation Configuring Navigate to your MariaDB config (Ex: /etc/mysql/mariadb.conf.d/50-server.cnf) Comment out bind-address by prefixing it with a #, so it looks like #bind-address = 127.0.0.1 Restart MySQL via sudo systemctl restart mysql Granting Permission Sign in to MySQL shell via sudo mysql -u root -p and enter your password

item.title: Adding Server
item.description: Adding server to web panel Navigate to Admin Panel-> Server Settings-> Add new server Fill out the information about the server with correct RCON Passwordand click Add Serverwhen done On refresh, record down the ID column for the corresponding server Configuring SourceBans++’s ServerID Navigate to addons/sourcemod/configs/sourcebans Edit sourcebans.cfgand modify ServerID to the ID value you recorded down Save, reupload file, and reload map/restart server

item.title: Could not find driver "MySQL"
item.description: Web Ensure you have installed the mysql extension of your PHP version (Ex: php7.2-mysql) Ensure pdo_mysql module is loaded, check phpinfo() for this Plugin Please make sure dbi.mysql.ext.so (dbi.mysql.ext.dll on Windows) extension exists and check if it is loaded via sm exts list Make sure the extension is executable via chmod u+x dbi.mysql.ext.so Install zlib (Requires SSH Access) 32-Bit Debian/Ubuntu: apt-get install zlib1g

item.title: Browser Freeze
item.description: Cloudflare If your site uses Cloudflare as reverse-proxy, make sure that Rocket Loaderis off Rocket Loader bundles mootools incorrect and cause unnecessary loop calls Debugging Most browsers bundles with a performance debugger, typically accessible via the hotkey F12 With the performance recorder open, start recording, navigate to the unresponsive page, end the recording after ~10 seconds and export it Join our Discord guild and post in #help-support with the exported performance file attached
